CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Compared with the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM system , the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PC 70 BM system has higher EQE values of 30-40 % in the range of 450-850 nm , which contributes to the improvement of I SC from 11.31 to 14.87 mA / cm^2.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph! Here are the entities I found:

1. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : This is a material combination, so it is a single entity.
2. PCBM - This is a material, so it is a single entity.
3. PC 70 BM - This is a material, so it is a single entity.

Therefore, the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu)
2. PCBM
3. PC 70 BM
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name":

1. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu)
2. PCBM

I removed the following entities that do not refer to "Material Name":

1. PC

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name", presented in a Markdown table:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) |
| PCBM |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Compared with the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM system , the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PC 70 BM system has higher EQE values of 30-40 % in the range of 450-850 nm , which contributes to the improvement of I SC from 11.31 to 14.87 mA / cm^2.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph! Here are the entities I found:

1. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM - This is a system or a combination of materials, represented by the abbreviations PDTP and DTDPP(Bu), and the material PCBM.
2. EQE - This stands for External Quantum Efficiency, which is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell in converting incoming light into electrical current.
3. I SC - This stands for Short-Circuit current, which is a measure of the current that flows through a solar cell when it is connected in a short-circuit configuration.
4. PC 70 BM - This stands for Poly-Coated 70 BM, which is a material or a combination of materials represented by the abbreviation PC and the number 70, followed by BM.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities that refer to Material Property in the paragraph:

1. PCBM - This stands for Poly-Coated Built-in Material, which is a type of material used in solar cells.
2. EQE - This stands for External Quantum Efficiency, which is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell in converting incoming light into electrical current.
3. I SC - This stands for Short-Circuit current, which is a measure of the current that flows through a solar cell when it is connected in a short-circuit configuration.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities related to Material Property in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCBM |
| EQE |
| I SC |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Compared with the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM system , the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PC 70 BM system has higher EQE values of 30-40 % in the range of 450-850 nm , which contributes to the improvement of I SC from 11.31 to 14.87 mA / cm^2.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! To identify the "Property Value" entities in the given paragraph, we can follow these steps:

1. Identify the entities that are mentioned in the paragraph:
	* PDTP
	* DTDPP(Bu)
	* PCBM
	* EQE
	* I SC
2. Determine whether each entity is a Property Value or not:
	* PDTP: No, it is a system
	* DTDPP(Bu): No, it is a system
	* PCBM: No, it is a material
	* EQE: Yes, it is a Property Value (a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell)
	* I SC: Yes, it is a Property Value (a measure of the current density of a solar cell)

Therefore, the "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are:

* EQE (30-40 % in the range of 450-850 nm)
* I SC (11.31 to 14.87 mA / cm^2)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to the value of material properties in the paragraph:

* EQE (30-40 % in the range of 450-850 nm)
* I SC (11.31 to 14.87 mA / cm^2)

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer to the value of material properties.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to the value of material properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 30-40 % in the range of 450-850 nm (EQE) |
| 11.31 to 14.87 mA / cm^2 (I SC) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
